title: Hadean Eon
text: The earliest eon of Earth's history, characterized by the planet's initial formation, extreme volcanic activity, and the creation of the Moon.

title: Archean Eon
text: The period when Earth's crust cooled enough for continents to begin forming and the first simple, single-celled life forms appeared in the oceans.

title: Proterozoic Eon
text: The longest eon, marked by the rise of oxygen in the atmosphere, the appearance of complex cells (eukaryotes), and the first multicellular organisms.

title: Paleozoic Era
text: The era of 'ancient life' starting with the Cambrian explosion. It saw the rise of fish, arthropods, amphibians, and the colonization of land by plants.

title: Mesozoic Era
text: Commonly known as the 'Age of Reptiles' or 'Age of Dinosaurs,' this era also saw the first appearance of mammals, birds, and flowering plants.

title: Cenozoic Era
text: The 'Age of Mammals' and the current geological era. It is characterized by the diversification of mammals, birds, and the eventual rise of humans.
